input_text.Prompt:
Fetchr, a US-based on-demand delivery startup has announced a partnership with California's Skycart and the UAE's Eniverse to develop the first autonomous drone delivery service in the region.

Skycart already offers a similar service to its users in the US. The startup delivers packages at customers' doorstep within 30 minutes or less using their UAV (Unmanned Aerial Vehicle) network.

Skycart and Eniverse had announced their partnership earlier this year to create Space Autonomous Drones, a company formed to offer drone-based delivery services in UAE through different collaborations. It was said at the time that they will start with a soft launch to operate in some specific areas of Dubai including Emirates Hills, The Meadows, The Springs, The Greens, and Jumeirah.

The addition of Fetchr will help take the project "the last mile", acording to the company's founder and CEO Idriss Al Rifai.

"At its core Fetchr is a technology company, and this partnership represents a significant milestone for us as we work towards achieving Fetchr's vision of enabling all deliveries through technology and disrupting the last mile delivery industry," said Al Rifai.

"We are committed to collaborating with the concerned authorities in the UAE and become part of the country's endeavours to be at the forefront of global innovation and implementation of such advanced technologies," he added.

Mohammed Johmani, Founder and CEO of Eniverse Technologies, said, "Today we mark the launch of a long-term relationship with Fetchr. We are delighted to be the first company to implement this new modern technology in the UAE, especially with a like-minded firm such as Fetchr in which we see great future growth potentials."

Generate a summary:
input_text.Response A: The BBC is launching a new campaign aimed at promoting the benefits of its online service to users. The campaign, which will run for a month, will feature a series of videos and articles that showcase the many ways in which the BBC's online service can be used to access news, entertainment, and other content. The campaign will also highlight the ways in which the BBC's online service can be used to connect with other people and to share information. The BBC's online service is available to anyone with an internet connection, and it offers a wide range of content that can be accessed on a variety of devices.
input_text.Response B: US delivery startup Fetchr has announced a partnership with drone-based delivery companies Skycart and Eniverse to develop the first autonomous drone delivery service in the region. Skycart is already offering a similar service in the US, delivering packages to customers' doorsteps within 30 minutes or less using its UAV (Unmanned Aerial Vehicle) network. The partnership will see the companies collaborate to take the project "the last mile" and provide drone-based delivery services in the UAE. Fetchr's CEO Idriss Al Rifai said: "We are committed to collaborating with the concerned authorities in the UAE and become part of the country's efforts to be at the forefront of global innovation and implementation of such advanced technologies."

input_meta.preamble_a: Respond authoritatively, assertively and persuasively, as if you are very knowledgeable about the topic.
input_meta.preamble_b: Respond using complex language, long words and technical terms, as if you are an expert.

label_annotations.feedback:
A is mentioning a lot about the BBC which there is no mention in the prompt about this.
B feels too long for a summary or could at least be broken down into a couple of paragraphs.
